Province.  It is comprised of two halves, Xiangyang (on the north side of the Han River) and Fancheng (on the south side of the river).
Linked to the Chinese train network.
Linked to the Chinese bus network.

value: content=The ancient city wall is mostly still standing, and it is possible to walk along the top of it.  Great views of the Han River from the top of the northern part of the wall.
content=A small but active Daoist temple run mainly by Daoist nuns.
content=Free internet in rooms (with Ethernet cable).  Has a good Chinese-style breakfast buffet.

- a famous Daoist mountain renown for its martial arts.  It can be a day trip out of Xiangfan (2 hour bus each way), but there are also places to stay on the mountain both for tourists and longer-term guests.  Wudang Shan is particularly famous for its Taiqi Quan and offers many multi-week classes (register in advance) open to Chinese and foreigners alike.
